issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: ACID 1.0 + ETL strategy should treat empty compacted files as uncovered deltas

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
HIVE-17562 is generating incorrect results intermittently. Also derived tables with default file format set to ORC is resulting in AIOB exception. 

1) Intermittent issue happens based on the order of selection of bucket file for ETL split strategy. Flipping the covered boolean flag looks error prone. The test case always passed when bucket_00000 is analyzed first. When bucket_00001 is analyzed first duplicate rows were generated. 
2) Some internal test revealed a test failure with ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception which happens for non-bucketed table.

comments.body:
This patch does the following
1) If base file has no stripes, treat it as orc split with start = 0, length = file length (this is how BI creates splits - entire file becomes a split).
2) As a result of 1) we no longer access covered array. No longer will throw ArrayIndexOutOfBounds
[~ekoifman] could you please take a look?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12890488/HIVE-17705-branch-2.patch
